name: Blue Sheep
description: Male blue sheep are up to a third larger than females and have more robust horns, up to 80 cm long. Its Czech name reflects its coloration, which serves as camouflage in rocky terrain. It can swiftly escape predators even on steep slopes and rocky ledges. Females and young form small herds, while adult males are solitary outside the breeding season.
proportions: Body 1.2–1.7 m; tail 10–20 cm; shoulder height 75–90 cm
